@graph.caption: Baingan Barta served on a white and pink patterned plate

@graph.name: Baingan Bharta (Roasted mashed spiced Eggplant) - Vegan Richa
Baingan Bharta

recipeInstructions.text: Roast the eggplant on a medium flame gas burner for 15-20 minutes, moving it every 4-5 minutes. It should start becoming charred and mushy and look like the picture above. I dont roast the eggplant completely like my mom does, because then the gas burner becomes very messy. The eggplant starts to drip once the skin gets charred and open. I usually put a foil and some water in the burner base to help with the cleaning later. The burner top though, you cant save:). I just char the skin to get the roasted taste in the eggplant.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast the eggplant on a medium flame gas burner for 15-20 minutes, moving it every 4-5 minutes. It should start becoming charred and mushy and look like the picture above. I dont roast the eggplant completely like my mom does, because then the gas burner becomes very messy. The eggplant starts to drip once the skin gets charred and open. I usually put a foil and some water in the burner base to help with the cleaning later. The burner top though, you cant save:). I just char the skin to get the roasted taste in the eggplant.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the eggplant cool and then remove the as much skin as possible.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the eggplant cool and then remove the as much skin as possible.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, heat the oil.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, heat the oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the mustard seeds and wait till they sputter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the mustard seeds and wait till they sputter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the turmeric, and coriander powder and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the turmeric, and coriander powder and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped ginger, garlic and Serrano pepper and mix well. Let cook on medium flame for 5 minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the chopped ginger, garlic and Serrano pepper and mix well. Let cook on medium flame for 5 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped onions and cook them till soft(5-7 minutes)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the chopped onions and cook them till soft(5-7 minutes)

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped tomato and the mashed eggplant and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the chopped tomato and the mashed eggplant and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in salt and cook covered on medium-low flame.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in salt and cook covered on medium-low flame.

recipeInstructions.text: In about 10-15 minutes the mixture will start to dry up a bit.
recipeInstructions.name: In about 10-15 minutes the mixture will start to dry up a bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Some people like the bharta more wet than others.. I like mine quite dry so I cook it for 10-15 minutes on low heat till it is dry and a nice earthy brown color.
recipeInstructions.name: Some people like the bharta more wet than others.. I like mine quite dry so I cook it for 10-15 minutes on low heat till it is dry and a nice earthy brown color.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot with chapatis, or Naan or any Indian Bread!
recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot with chapatis, or Naan or any Indian Bread!
